description: The round payoff this round was 5. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -5000.

The game is a repeated strategic interaction where both players have a safe default (option 1) and an exploitable but risky deviation (option 2); this means deviating only pays off if the opponent sticks with the default

Mutual deviation is very costly—as seen by the recorded round where, with a round input of 5, both players choosing option 2 resulted in a large negative payoff (–5,000), showing that simultaneous risk-taking leads to punishment

Both players are aware of each other’s default actions, which sets up potential opportunities for exploitation if one player can signal a commitment to the default while tempting a deviation from the opponent; however, if both attempt to deviate, the outcome becomes disastrous
